alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 9:24PM CDT until April 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... Southeastern Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Northwestern Douglas County in east central Kansas... Northeastern Osage County in east central Kansas... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 923 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Carbondale, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 912 PM, nickel-sized hail was reported 1 Mile ESE of Burlingame. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Southeastern Topeka, Lawrence, Carbondale, Tecumseh, Richland, Overbrook, Perry, Lecompton, Clinton, Pauline, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Grantville, Clinton Lake and Berryton. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 178 and 205. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
